intro: Psiadia leucophylla subsp. cacuminum, commonly known as the white-leaved psiadia, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in compact clusters, typical of the daisy family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. This subspecies is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
